result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel R Willman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel R Willman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel R Willman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel R Willman
Current: N2685 Lakeview Dr, Montello, WI 53949 United States  (Effective: 06-04-2015)
Prior: 837 County Road K, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965 United States
Drug court at 06-18-2015 01:00 pm
Letter from Treatment Court dated 05-22-15
Signed by Judge 05-07-15
TREATMENT COURT AGREEMENT

Defendant Joel R Willman in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that since the filing of the Information in this case, the defendant has been sentenced in Columbia County and that now makes this a 6th offense.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1 and state will move to dismiss Cts 2-3, charges in 14CT88 and charges in 13TR2451 and 13TR2452.  Defendant will be entering the Treatment Court Program and be placed on probtion with conditions.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1 (6th Offense OWI).  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 (6th Offense OWI).  Court will also dismiss Cts 2-3 in 14CF19 and charges in 14CT88, 13TR2451 & 13TR2452.
Counsel waive request for PSI.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  
BY THE COURT:
Ct 1:
Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 36 months.  Conditions:  *Participate in and graduate from the Marquette County Treatment Court Program.  *Pay fine of $600.00 plus costs for a total of $1519.00.  *DL revocation and Ignition Interlock for 36 months.  *AODA and comply with any treatment.  *Serve 12 months in the Marquette County Jail, concurrent to any sentence he is now serving.  Granted huber and good-time credit.  Commence forthwith.  Court will stay 6 months of that sentence to be used, if needed, during the Treatment Court Program.  Sentence may be served in Columbia County if he is accepted.  *Pay DNA surcharge.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Petition for Half-Priced IID
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joel R Willman in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic matters 13TR2451 & 13TR2452 tracking with:
Atty Hendee states that information was filed on July 17th.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant has moved to Montello now and that was an issue with MCDS which has now been taken care of.
Atty Gumz states that Columbia County's case will be scheduled in December and asks that this be set after that.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.

Atty Gumz asks the court for 1/2 price IID.
Atty Hendee takes no position on the matter.
BY THE COURT:  Petition for 1/2 price IID will be granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on September 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joel R Willman in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading. Atty Gumz states that the defendant has spoke with MCDS for possible participation on treatment court.  Atty Gumz asks for 30 - 60 days to give time for the defendant to look into treatment court further.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Arraignment.
bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
STATE'S
Arraignment on July 17, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Joel R Willman in court with attorney Mark J Gumz / student intern Steve Hughes.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Traffic tickets tracking with.
Atty Hendee states that in talking with Atty Gumz the defendant will be waiving the Preliminary Hearing.  Mr. Hughes agrees with the waiver.  Court questions the defendant.
Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.

Mr. Hughes asks for an Arraignment date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Arraignment.
